intro: Crepinia solita, commonly known as the solitary crepe myrtle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
